description: The genus Listeria comprises ten species, namely: L. monocytogenes, L. ivanovii, L. innocua, L. welshimeri, L. seeligeri, L. grayi, L.murrayi, L. rocourtiae, L. fleischmannii and L. weihenstephanensis. L. monocytogenes is the only one of the ten species that can cause human disease. Listeria  can grow in a wide range of temperatures (from 1°C to 45°C). It is a common contaminant of fresh and preserved foods.
name: Listeria monocytogenes Antibodies and Antigens
